comments: This course provides an overview of recent research on the social implications of new information and communication technologies. The goal of this course is to focus on how recent technological innovations, including personal computing, video games, the Internet and mobile phones may be changing the way we interact with those around us.   Almost every student that wrote a review seemed to enjoy the course. One student wrote that the course was, a very interesting course dealing with very relevant and current material.” The only complaint of the course was that students, “don’t like being forced to write about weekly readings.”  Most students wrote praise of Professor Hampton. Students felt that, “Professor Hampton is engaging and funny.” Some students felt that Professor Hampton could have tried to find conclusions to class conversations.  This course is an upper level course. It has two prerequisites, which are listed as, COMM 125 or COMM 130. It is not listed as fulfilling any requirements.
